english: radish/turnip (as in 萝卜); creeping vine; suffix in plant names; used in transliterations

etymology.description: semantic 艸 + phonetic 羅; simplified from 蘿 (羅 → 罗).
etymology.interpretation: The grass component 艸 signals a plant. 羅 contributes the sound luó; in the simplified form, 羅 was reduced to 罗 while retaining the plant semantic indicator.
etymology.simplification: Reduced stroke count by replacing the phonetic 羅 with its simplified form 罗 under 艹, preserving pronunciation and meaning.

examples.chinese: 他买了两斤萝卜(他買了兩斤蘿蔔)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mǎi le liǎng jīn luóbo.
examples.english: He bought two jin of radishes.

examples.chinese: 我爱吃菠萝(我愛吃菠蘿)。
篱笆上爬满了藤萝(籬笆上爬滿了藤蘿)。
examples.pinyin: Líbā shàng pá mǎn le téngluó.
examples.english: The fence is covered with wisteria vines.
